fields.description: When set to '1', extended next pages are enabled. When set to '0', extended next pages are disabled. When enabled (1) transmission of next page with non-null code field is possible. The next page registers should be initialized and must be set (handshaking) every time a next page is received. When disabled (0) only null next page is transmitted in response to received next pages from link partner. Note: when 0, the registers AN_XNP are not writable (i.e. the 48bit next page message will internally be a null next page, having bit0 and bit13 set to 1, ignoring the values in AN_XNP registers).

fields.name: EthRxSfdAny

fields.description: Link Pause Compatibility with PFC Mode. If set to '1', Pause frames in legacy pause mode are processed similar to PFC frames in PFC mode, i.e. the transmit path is not paused by incoming Pause frames, only the pause status ff_rx_pfc_xoff<n>(0) is asserted as long as the internal pause timer has not expired. If set to '0' (Reset value), Pause frames are processed as described in FIXME on page FIXME. This bit is relevant only when PFC_MODE=0.
fields.name: EthPausePfcComp

fields.description: Priority Flow Control Mode. If set to '1', the Core generates and processes PFC control frames according to the Priority Flow Control Interface signals. If set to'0' (Reset Value), the Core operates in legacy Pause Frame mode and generates and processes standard Pause Frames (see FIXME).
fields.name: EthPfcMode

fields.description: If set to '1', sets the reconciliation sublayer parameter col_cnt to the value set in the global register WAN_RS_COL_CNT. When disabled (0), the col_cnt is set as defined by the IEEE 802.3ae standard (128) ignoring the global setting.
fields.name: EthRsColCntExt

fields.description: Disable Payload Length Check. If set to '0' (Reset value), the Core checks the frame's payload length with the frame's Length/Type field. If set to '1', the payload length check is disabled.
fields.name: EthNoLgthCheck

fields.description: Force Idle Generation. If set to '1', the MAC permanently sends XL/CGMII Idle sequences even when faults are received.
fields.name: EthSendIdle

fields.description: Enable PHY Transmit. If set to '1', the signal phy_txena<n> is set to '1'. If set to '0' (Reset value), the signal phy_txena<n> is set to '0'.
fields.name: EthPhyTxEna

fields.description: Enable Receive Errored Frame Discard. If set to '1', any frame received with an error is discarded in the Core and not forwarded to the client interface. If set to '0' (Reset value), errored frames are forwarded to the client interface with ff_rx_err asserted. Note: Not available in this implementation.
fields.name: EthRxErrDiscard

fields.description: Enable Reception of all Command Frames. If set to '1', all command frames are accepted. If set to '0' (Reset Value), only Pause frames are accepted and all other command frames are rejected. A command or control frame is defined as having a type of 0x8808 and an opcode field that does not match the pause opcode.
fields.name: EthCmdFrameEna

fields.description: Self-Clearing Software Reset. When written with '1', all Statistics Counters are reset to 0.
fields.name: EthSwReset

fields.description: Enable Transmit Padding. If set to '1' (Reset value), the MAC transmit logic inserts padding bytes to always generate frames with a minimum length of 64 bytes with CRC or 60 bytes without CRC. If set to '0', the MAC transmit logic can send unpadded frames. Note: If TX_PAD_EN=0 in 40G and 100G mode of operation, the MAC does not insert padding bytes for frames equal or larger than 32 bytes, frames smaller than 32 bytes are always padded. If TX_PAD_EN=0 in 10G mode of operation, the MAC can send short unpadded frames of any size.
fields.name: EthTxPadEn

fields.description: Enable PHY Interface Loopback. If set to '1', the signal loop_ena<n> is set to '1'. If set to '0' (Reset value), the signal loop_ena<n> is set to '0'.
fields.name: EthLoopBackEn

fields.description: Set Source MAC Address on Transmit. If set to '1', the MAC overwrites the source MAC address received from the client interface with the MAC address programmed in registers MAC_ADDR_0 and MAC_ADDR_1 . If set to '0' (Reset value), the source MAC address from the client interface is transmitted unmodified to the line.
fields.name: EthTxAddrIns

fields.description:
Ignore Pause Frame Quanta. If set to '1', received pause frames are ignored by the MAC. If set to '0' (Reset value), the transmit process is stopped for the amount of time specified in the pause quanta received within a pause frame.
This bit is relevant only when PFC_MODE=0.
fields.name: EthPauseIgnore

fields.description: Terminate / Forward Pause Frames. If set to '1', pause frames are forwarded to the user application. If set to '0' (Reset value), pause frames are terminated and discarded within the MAC.
fields.name: EthPauseFwd

fields.description:
Terminate / Forward Received CRC. If set to '1', the CRC field of received frames is forwarded with the frame to the user application. If set to '0' (Reset value), the CRC field is stripped from the frame.
Note: If padding (Bit PAD_EN set to '1') is enabled, CRC_FWD is ignored.
fields.name: EthCrcFwd

fields.description:
Enable Frame Padding Removal in receive path. If set to '1', padding is removed before the frame is conveyed to the MAC client application. If set to '0' (Reset value), no padding is removed on receive by the MAC.
Note: Not available in this implementation.
fields.name: EthPadEn

fields.description: Enable MAC Promiscuous Operation. If set to '1', all frames are received without any MAC address filtering. If set to '0' (Reset value), unicast frames with a destination address not matching the Core MAC address (programmed in registers MAC_ADDR_0 and MAC_ADDR_1) are rejected.
fields.name: EthPromisEn

fields.description:
Enable WAN Mode. Sets WAN mode (1) or LAN mode (0, default) of operation.
Note: When changing the mode, verify correct setting of the transmit Inter-Packet-Gap (IPG) in register TX_IPG_LENGTH.
Note: This bit is only available in 10G mode of operation. It is reserved in 40G and 100G mode of operation.
fields.name: EthWanMode

fields.description: MAC Receive Path Enable. Should be set to '1' to enable the MAC receive path, should be set to '0' (Reset value) to disable the MAC receive path.
fields.name: EthRxEna

fields.description: MAC Transmit Path Enable. Should be set to '1' to enable the MAC transmit path, should be set to '0' (Reset value) to disable the MAC transmit path.
fields.name: EthTxEna

fields.description: Current credit register value (for debug purpose only).
fields.name: EthCreditReg

fields.description: Self-clearing Credit Reset. When written with a '1', this bit will trigger a reset of the RX application FIFO and will cause the INIT_CREDIT value to be loaded into the credit register. This bit should be programmed before enabling the MAC and after writing the initial credit value.
fields.name: EthCreditTrigger

fields.description: Set to '1' when the Core implements the FEC functions to indicate that the FEC is able to report FEC decoding errors to the PCS Layer. Set to '0' when the Core does not implement the FEC functions.
fields.name: EthFecErrIndicationAble

fields.description: Set to '1' when the Core implements the FEC functions, set to '0' when the Core does not implement the FEC functions.
fields.name: EthFecAble

fields.description: Bits 15:0 of the register are bits 31:16 of the counter.(clear on read)
fields.name: EthFecBlocksCountHi

fields.description: Bits 15:0 of the register are bits 15:0 of the counter.(clear on read)
fields.name: EthFecBlocksCountLo

fields.description: Should be set to '1' to configure the FEC decoder to indicate errors to the PCS layer. Should be set to '0' (Reset value) to configure the FEC decoder to not indicate errors to the PCS layer.
fields.name: EthFecErrIndicationEnble

fields.description: Should be set to '1' to force the Core FEC functions. Should be set to '0' (Reset value) to control the Core FEC functions by the autonegotiation core.
fields.name: EthFecEnable

fields.description: Should be set to '1' to enable the Base-R startup protocol. Should be set to '0' (Reset value) to disable the Base-R startup protocol.
fields.name: EthFecTrainingEnable

fields.description: Self Clearing Bit, should be set to '1' to restart the Base-R startup protocol. When '0' (Reset value) normal operation is enabled.
fields.name: EthFecRestartTraining

fields.description: Set '1' to preset the device transmitter coefficients, set to '0' to enable normal operation.
fields.name: EthFecLdPreset

fields.description: Set '1' to initialize the device transmitter coefficients, set to '0' to enable normal operation.
fields.name: EthFecLdInitialize

fields.description: Coef (+1) Update: 11 = reserved, 01 = increment, 10 = decrement, 00 = hold.
fields.name: EthFecLdCoefP1Update

fields.description: Coef (0) Update: 11 = reserved, 01 = increment, 10 = decrement, 00 = hold.
fields.name: EthFecLdCoef0Update

fields.description: Coef (-1) Update: 11 = reserved, 01 = increment, 10 = decrement, 00 = hold.
fields.name: EthFecLdCoefM1Update

fields.description: Should be set '1' to preset the transmitter coefficients, should be to '0' to enable normal operation.
fields.name: EthFecLpPreset

fields.description: Should be set '1' to initialize the transmitter coefficients, should be to '0' to enable normal operation.
fields.name: EthFecLpInitialize

fields.description: Coef (+1) Update: 11 = reserved, 01 = increment, 10 = decrement, 00 = hold.
fields.name: EthFecLpCoefP1Update

fields.description: Coef (0) Update: 11 = reserved, 01 = increment, 10 = decrement, 00 = hold.
fields.name: EthFecLpCoef0Update

fields.description: Coef (-1) Update: 11 = reserved, 01 = increment, 10 = decrement, 00 = hold.
fields.name: EthFecLpCoefM1Update

fields.description: When set to '1', indicates that the training process is complete.
fields.name: EthFecSignalDetection

fields.description: When set to '0', indicates that Training failure has not been detected. When set to '1', indicates that Training failure has been detected.
fields.name: EthFecTrainingFail

fields.description: When set to '0', indicates that the startup protocol is completed. When set to '1', indicates that the startup protocol is in progress.
fields.name: EthFecStartUpStatus

fields.description: When set to '0', indicates that Training frame delineation is not detected. When set to '1', indicates that Training frame delineation is detected.
fields.name: EthFecFrameLock

fields.description: When set to '0', indicates that the Receiver training is proceeding. When set to '1' by the application, indicates that the Receiver is trained and is ready to receive data. Note: this bit is writable, which differs from the corresponding notion in IEEE 802.3 Clause 45.2.1.77 for MMD register 1.151) as the application has to decide when the local device is trained. Writing this bit sets the mr_trained variable allowing the training statemachine to proceed (see IEEE 802.3 Clause 72.6.10.3.1).
fields.name: EthFecRcvrStatus

fields.description: Set to '1' when the FEC decoder has locked on the block boundary on virtual lane 1. Set to '0' otherwise. Note: This bit is only valid in 100G mode of operation.
fields.name: EthFecLockedOdd

fields.description: Set to '1' when the FEC decoder has locked on the block boundary. Set to '0' otherwise. Note: In 100G mode of operation, this bit refers to virtual lane 0.
fields.name: EthFecLocked

fields.description: Maximum supported frame length. The MAC supports any frame size up to 16352 bytes (0x3fe0). Typical settings are 1518 for standard. Set to 1536 after Reset. Bits 31:16 are unused and always set to '0'.
fields.name: EthFrmLength

fields.description: Bit 8 enables (1) or disables (0) multicast frame reception for the entry.
fields.name: EthHashTableMcEn

fields.description: Bits 5:0 specify the hash table address (code).
fields.name: EthHashTableAddr

fields.description: Specifies the initial/max credit value to be loaded. Note: The initial credit value must be set to '8' when operating in 10G mode of operation, '7' when operating in 40G mode of operation, and '2' when operating in 100G mode of operation.
fields.name: EthInitCredit

fields.description: The lower 32-Bit of the 48-Bit MAC Address. Bit 0 is LSB.
fields.name: EthMacAddr0

fields.description: The upper 16-Bit of the 48-Bit MAC Address. Bit 0 is Bit 32 of MAC address. Bits 31:16 are unused and always set to '0'.
fields.name: EthMacAddr1

fields.description: MDIO clock divisor. A value of 5 to 511 can be set. The frequency is reg_clk/((2*divisor)+1). The reset default is defined by the synthesis package setting MDIO_CLK_DIV. Setting the divisor to 0 disables MDC.
fields.name: EthMdioClkDivisor

fields.description: Enable Clause 45 support. If '0', Clause 22 transactions are used. If '1' (default), Clause 45 transactions are used.
fields.name: EthEnableClause45

fields.description: Disable Preamble (if '1').
fields.name: EthDisPreamble

fields.description: MDIO hold time setting as per table.
fields.name: EthMdioHoldTime

fields.description: MDIO read error (read only bit). If '1', the last read transaction had no response from a PHY and the data read could be invalid. This can happen, if the PHY address does not match any PHY that is available on the MDIO bus.
fields.name: EthMdioRdError

fields.description: MDIO busy (read only bit). If '1' an MDIO transaction is currently ongoing. If '0' the application can access the other registers.
fields.name: EthMdioBusy

fields.description: If written with '1', a read transaction is initiated..
fields.name: EthMdioRdCmd

fields.description: If written with '1', a read with address post-increment transaction is initiated. Only for Clause 45 transactions.
fields.name: EthMdioRdCmdCl45

fields.description: Port address(clause 45) || PHY address(clause 22).
fields.name: EthMdioPortPhyAddr

fields.description: Device address(clause 45) || Register address(clause 22).
fields.name: EthMdioDevRegAddr

fields.description: MDIO busy as found in MDIO_STATUS.0. The value read is invalid as long as Bit 31 is '1'. (read only bit).
fields.name: EthMdioBusy

fields.description: 16 bit data word When written: Initiates a write transaction to the PHY. The COMMAND register must have been initialized. The busy status bit will be set immediately and cleared when the write transaction has finished. When read: Returns the data read from the PHY register after a read transaction has been completed (initiated by writing a '1' to Bit 15 or Bit 14 of the COMMAND register).
fields.name: EthMdioData

fields.description: Address of register within Clause 45 PHY device to read from or write to. After writing this register an address-write transaction will be initiated to set the PHY's internal address register to the value given. The COMMAND register must have been initialized before the first write to this register. Note: When a read post increment access is issued this register will not change, only the register inside the PHY device is incremented. The register is relevant only when Clause 45 mode has been enabled. It should not be used when Clause 22 mode is active.
fields.name: EthMdioRegAddr

fields.description: Segment mode control (2 bits per segment) SEG0=1:0, SEG1=3:2...
fields.name: EthSegmentModeCtl

fields.description: CL1_PAUSE_QUANTA. Value to be sent for the PFC quanta value for that class when a class XOFF is triggered.
fields.name: EthPauseQuantaCL1

fields.description: CL0_PAUSE_QUANTA. Value to be sent for the PFC quanta value for that class when a class XOFF is triggered. When normal pause mode is enabled, CL0_PAUSE_QUANTA is used.
fields.name: EthPauseQuantaCL0

fields.description: CL3_PAUSE_QUANTA. Value to be sent for the PFC quanta value for that class when a class XOFF is triggered.
fields.name: EthPauseQuantaCL3

fields.description: CL2_PAUSE_QUANTA. Value to be sent for the PFC quanta value for that class when a class XOFF is triggered.
fields.name: EthPauseQuantaCL2

fields.description: CL5_PAUSE_QUANTA. Value to be sent for the PFC quanta value for that class when a class XOFF is triggered.
fields.name: EthPauseQuantaCL5

fields.description: CL4_PAUSE_QUANTA. Value to be sent for the PFC quanta value for that class when a class XOFF is triggered.
fields.name: EthPauseQuantaCL4

fields.description: CL7_PAUSE_QUANTA. Value to be sent for the PFC quanta value for that class when a class XOFF is triggered.
fields.name: EthPauseQuantaCL7

fields.description: CL6_PAUSE_QUANTA. Value to be sent for the PFC quanta value for that class when a class XOFF is triggered.
fields.name: EthPauseQuantaCL6

fields.description: Enable PRBS9 generator on lane 11.
fields.name: EthPrbs9EnSeg11

fields.description: Enable PRBS9 generator on lane 10.
fields.name: EthPrbs9EnSeg10

fields.description: Enable PRBS9 generator on lane 9.
fields.name: EthPrbs9EnSeg9

fields.name: EthPrbs9EnSeg8

fields.description: Enable PRBS9 generator on lane 7.
fields.name: EthPrbs9EnSeg7

fields.name: EthPrbs9EnSeg6

fields.name: EthPrbs9EnSeg5

fields.description: Enable PRBS9 generator on lane 1.
fields.name: EthPrbs9EnSeg1

fields.description: Enable PRBS9 generator on lane 0.
fields.name: EthPrbs9EnSeg0

fields.name: EthPrbs31EnSeg11

fields.description: Enable PRBS31 generator on lane 10.
fields.name: EthPrbs31EnSeg10

fields.description: Enable PRBS31 generator on lane 9.
fields.name: EthPrbs31EnSeg9

fields.description: Enable PRBS31 generator on lane 8.
fields.name: EthPrbs31EnSeg8

fields.description: Enable PRBS31 generator on lane 7.
fields.name: EthPrbs31EnSeg7

fields.description: Enable PRBS31 generator on lane 4.

fields.description: Enable PRBS31 generator on lane 3.

fields.description: Enable PRBS31 generator on lane 2.
fields.name: EthPrbs31EnSeg2

fields.description: Enable PRBS31 generator on lane 1.
fields.name: EthPrbs31EnSeg1

fields.description: Enable PRBS31 generator on lane 0.
fields.name: EthPrbs31EnSeg0

fields.description: Bits 15:0 of the register are the count.(clear on read)
fields.name: EthPrbsErrCnt

fields.description: User defined Tx preamble control (2 bits per segment) SEG0=1:0, SEG1=3:2....
fields.name: EthSegmentPrmblCtl

fields.description: CL1_QUANTA_THRESH. When a PFC quanta timer counts down and reaches this value, a refresh pause frame should be sent with the programmed full quanta value if the input level indicates that a pause condition still exists.
fields.name: EthQuantaThreshCL1

fields.description: CL0_QUANTA_THRESH. When a PFC quanta timer counts down and reaches this value, a refresh pause frame should be sent with the programmed full quanta value if the input level indicates that a pause condition still exists. Note: Only a value >1 enables this function.When normal pause mode is enabled, CL0_QUANTA_THRESH is used for refreshing pause frames.
fields.name: EthQuantaThreshCL0

fields.description: CL3_QUANTA_THRESH. When a PFC quanta timer counts down and reaches this value, a refresh pause frame should be sent with the programmed full quanta value if the input level indicates that a pause condition still exists.
fields.name: EthQuantaThreshCL3

fields.description: CL2_QUANTA_THRESH. When a PFC quanta timer counts down and reaches this value, a refresh pause frame should be sent with the programmed full quanta value if the input level indicates that a pause condition still exists. Note: Only a value >1 enables this function.
fields.name: EthQuantaThreshCL2

fields.description: CL5_QUANTA_THRESH. When a PFC quanta timer counts down and reaches this value, a refresh pause frame should be sent with the programmed full quanta value if the input level indicates that a pause condition still exists.
fields.name: EthQuantaThreshCL5

fields.description: CL4_QUANTA_THRESH. When a PFC quanta timer counts down and reaches this value, a refresh pause frame should be sent with the programmed full quanta value if the input level indicates that a pause condition still exists. Note: Only a value >1 enables this function.
fields.name: EthQuantaThreshCL4

fields.description: CL7_QUANTA_THRESH. When a PFC quanta timer counts down and reaches this value, a refresh pause frame should be sent with the programmed full quanta value if the input level indicates that a pause condition still exists.
fields.name: EthQuantaThreshCL7

fields.description: CL6_QUANTA_THRESH. When a PFC quanta timer counts down and reaches this value, a refresh pause frame should be sent with the programmed full quanta value if the input level indicates that a pause condition still exists. Note: Only a value >1 enables this function.
fields.name: EthQuantaThreshCL6

fields.description: Indicates the customer version of the ETH Mac RTL.
fields.name: EthCustVer

fields.description: Indicates the core version of the ETH Mac RTL.
fields.name: EthCoreVer

fields.description: Indicates the core revision of the ETH Mac RTL.
fields.name: EthCoreRev

fields.description: RX FIFO almost full threshold Read Only Fixed thresholds set with a Core configuration parameter (see User Guide document for details).
fields.name: EthRxFifoAlmostFullWm

fields.description: RX FIFO almost empty threshold. Read Only Fixed thresholds set with a Core configuration parameter (see User Guide document for details).
fields.name: EthRxFifoAlmostEmptyWm

fields.description: RX section empty threshold, reset value is 0x0. All threshold values are in steps of segment data words (10G: 32-bit, 40G: 128-bit, 100G: 384-bit). See also FIXME.
fields.name: EthRxSectionEmptyWm

fields.description: RX section available threshold, reset value is 0x3.
fields.name: EthRxSectionAvailWm

fields.description: Status bit for software to read the pause status. One bit for each of the 8 classes.
fields.name: EthRxPauseStatus

fields.description: The Scratch Register provides a memory location to test the register access.
fields.name: EthScratch

fields.description: Latched high page received indication (cleared on read).
fields.name: EthLatchedHiPageRcvd

fields.description: Real-time page receive indication.
fields.name: EthRealTimePageRcvd

fields.description: Next page capable. Set to '1' to indicate next page capability.
fields.name: EthNextPageCapable

fields.description: Acknowledgement bit used during autonegotiation. Setting of the bit in the device ability advertisement register is not relevant to the operation of the autonegotiation function. The bit is typically set in the received partner ability register upon successful completion of autonegotiation.
fields.name: EthACK

fields.description: Remote fault condition advertise
fields.name: EthRemoteFault

fields.description: Advertise that the PCS supports pause on both transmit and receive. PS2 (ASM_DIR) indicates pause asymmetry. Refer to IEEE802.3 Clause 37.2.4.2 for pause resolution.
fields.name: EthPS2

fields.description: Advertise that the PCS supports pause on both transmit and receive. PS1 (Pause) indicates pause capability.Refer to IEEE802.3 Clause 37.2.4.2 for pause resolution. The device-ability register reset to 1 indicating full pause support in both directions
fields.name: EthPS1

fields.description: Half Duplex Support. Set to '1' when the device advertises that is supports Half Duplex Mode of operation.
fields.name: EthHalfDuplex

fields.description:
Full Duplex Support. Set to '1' when the device advertises that it supports Full Duplex Mode of operation.
The device-ability (advertisement) register reset value sets the bit to 1 indicating full duplex operation.
fields.name: EthFullDuplex

fields.description:
Enable SGMII/1000Base-X PCS instead of XGMII/10GBase-R for the 10G MAC.
When set (1) the SGMII PCS layer becomes active and the channel is configured for 1G mode of operation. The other bits in this register have no meaning if this bit is not set. When cleared (0, default) the MAC operates in 10G mode with an XGMII (internally) and 10GBase-R PCS Layer. Note: This bit only configures the datapath within the combined MAC and PCS layers. It does not change the PMA/SERDES module, externally to the core. This must be controlled elsewhere to adapt the correct interface width (10-bit) and speed (125MHz).
Note: After setting this bit=1, a PCS soft reset should be performed by writing bit15 of the PCS control register.
fields.name: EthSgmiiPcsEnable

fields.description: SGMII Halfduplex Mode: When set (1), halfduplex is enabled, when cleared, fullduplex is enabled (default). Note: halfduplex is NOT supported in this implementation. This bit setting has no effect.
fields.name: EthSgmiiHDuplex

fields.description: SGMII Speed. When the PCS operates in SGMII mode (SGMII_ENA set to '1') and when the PCS is programmed not to be automatically configured (USE_SGMII_AN set to '0'), sets the PCS speed of operation (Bit 4:0): Bits ignored when SGMII_ENA=0 or USE_SGMII_AN=0..
fields.name: EthSgmiiSpeed

fields.description: Use the SGMII Auto-Negotiation Results to Program the PCS Speed. When set to '0' (Reset Value), the PCS operation should be programmed with the register bit SGMII_SPEED and SGMII_DUPLEX. When '1', the PCS operation is automatically set according to the Partner abilities advertised during Auto-Negotiation. Ignored when SGMII_ENA is set to '0'.
fields.name: EthUseSgmiiAn

fields.description: SGMII Mode Enable. When set to '0' (Reset Value), the PCS operates in standard 1000Base-X Gigabit mode, when set to '1', the PCS operates in SGMII Mode. If the bit is '0' the bits 1..4 of this register are ignored.
fields.name: EthSgmiiEna

fields.description: Auto Negotiation Link Timer (RW). Set the Link Timer value from 0 to 16ms in 8ns steps (125MHz clock periods). The reset value sets the Link Timer to 10ms (1250000). Bits 20:16 are stored in the HI register.
fields.name: EthLinkTimerHi

fields.description: Auto Negotiation Link Timer (RW). Set the Link Timer value from 0 to 16ms in 8ns steps (125MHz clock periods). The reset value sets the Link Timer to 10ms (1250000). Bits 15:0 are stored in the LO register.
fields.name: EthLinkTimerLo

fields.description: Read only bit, used by the SGMII PHY to advertise the Link Partner Copper status: 1=Copper interface link is up 0=Copper interface link is down.
fields.name: EthCopperLinkStatus

fields.description: Acknowledgement bit used during autonegotiation. Setting of the bit in the device ability advertisement register is not relevant to the operation of the autonegotiation function. The bit is typically set in the received partner ability register upon successful completion of autonegotiation.
fields.name: EthACK

fields.description: Read only bit, used by the SGMII PHY to advertise the Link Partner Copper duplex capability: 0=Copper Interface resolved to Half-Duplex 1=Copper Interface resolved to Full-Duplex
fields.name: EthCopperDuplexStatus

fields.description: Read only bits, used to by the SGMII PHY to advertise the Copper interface speed (Bit 11:10).
fields.name: EthCopperSpeed

fields.description: Self-Clearing Reset Command Register. When set to '1', a synchronous reset pulse is generated which resets all the PCS state machines, the Comma detection function and the 8b/10b coder / decoder. '0' for normal operation.
fields.name: EthPcsReset

fields.description: When set to '1', a serial loopback is implemented in the PMA. Should be set to '0' (Reset value) during normal operation. (setting not relevant, function not used.)
fields.name: EthPhyLoopBack

fields.description: Read only bits that define that the PCS only operates in Gigabit mode.
fields.name: EthSgmiiSpeedSel0

fields.description: When set to 1 (Reset value) Auto Negotiation is enabled, set to 0 to disable Auto Negotiation.
fields.name: EthAutoNegEnable

fields.description: When set to '1', the PCS drives its powerdown output pin.(setting not relevant, function not used.)
fields.name: EthPowerDown

fields.description: When set to '1', the PCS is isolated from the MAC Layer device. Should be set to '0' (Reset value) to enable normal operation. Note: When set keeps the PCS in reset (equals bit15=1 permanently).
fields.name: EthIsolate

fields.description: Self-clearing command bit: Set to '1' to restart an auto negotiation sequence. Set to '0' (Reset value) in normal operation mode.
fields.name: EthRestartAutoNeg

fields.description: Read only bit always set to '1' to indication that the PCS only supports Full Duplex mode of operation and does not support Half Duplex mode of operation.
fields.name: EthDuplexMode

fields.description: Half duplex not supported by the PCS, read only bit set to '0'.
fields.name: EthCollisionTest

fields.description: Read only bits that define that the PCS only operates in Gigabit mode.
fields.name: EthSgmiiSpeedSel1

fields.description: Read Only bit set to '0' to indicate that the PCS does NOT support 100Base-T4 operation.
fields.name: Eth100T4

fields.description:
Transmit Inter-Packet-Gap (IPG) value.
A 7-bit value: Depending on LAN or WAN mode of operation (see COMMAND_CONFIG, the value has the following meaning:LAN Mode: Number of octets in steps of 4. Valid values are 8, 12, 16, ..., 100. DIC is fully supported for any setting. A default of 12 (reset value) must be set to conform to IEEE802.3ae. Warning: When set to 8, PCS layers may not be able to perform clock rate compensation.WAN Mode: Stretch factor. Valid values are 4..15. The stretch factor is calculated as (value+1)*8. A default of 12 (reset value) must be set to conform to IEEE 802.3ae (i.e. 13*8=104). A larger value shrinks the IPG (increasing bandwidth).
The reset value 12 leads to IEEE802.3ae conformant behavior in both modes.
Note: WAN mode is only available in 10G mode of operation.
fields.name: EthTxIpgLength

fields.description: The lower 32-Bit of the user defined 56-Bit Transmit Preamble. Bit 0 is LSB.

fields.description: The upper 24-Bit of the user defined 56-Bit Transmit Preamble. Bit 0 is bit 32 of the preamble.
fields.name: EthTxPreamble1

fields.description: Bit 0: Virtual Lane Marker Interval. When set to '0' (reset value), alignment markers are inserted and detected after every 16383 blocks according to IEEE 802.3ba standard specification. For test purposes, setting this bit to '1' will change the interval to 1023 blocks.
fields.name: EthVLIntvl

fields.description: VLAN Tag TPID.

fields.description: A 16-bit value used as limit for the column-counter for the 10GBase-R fault statemachine (IEEE802.3ae Clause 46.3.4). Defaults to 127 for IEEE 802.3ae conformant behavior. The setting is relevant only in 12x10G mode of operation and is used by a 10G MAC when it is configured to use the extended column counter (see command_config(RS_COL_CNT_EXT)). Bits 31:16: reserved, write 0 always.
fields.name: EthWanRsColCnt

fields.description: For one or more enabled lanes, the 64b/67b synchronization has changed, either from out of sync to in sync or from in sync to out of sync. SLE_RX_WRD SYNC MMR (0x3C0) must be cleared before WRD_SYN_CHANGE bit[24] will clear. A flow diagram for achieving and maintaining 64B/67B word boundary lock is shown in figure 5-10 on page 25 of the Interlaken Protocol Definition. Once we get sync ( the middle64B/67B word lock state in the diagram) we need to get 16 out of 64 words with bad framing bits in order to go out of sync, the upper and lower values are set by 0x218 : Receive Control Register.

fields.description:
When doing programmable patterns, this bit pattern is sent REPA times. When doing PRBS, this value programs the desired polynomial. The recommended Interlaken polynomials are programmed as follows:
PRBS31 : x^31 + x^28 + 1 : 32'h90000001 (bits 31, 28, and 0 are set)
PRBS23 : x^23 + x^18 + 1 : 32'h00840001 (bits 23, 18, and 0 are set)
PRBS7 : x^7 + x^6 + 1 : 32'h000000C1 (bits 7, 6, and 0 are set)
Other commonly used PRBS polynomials are also supported:
PRBS9 : x^9 + x^5 + 1 : 32'h00000221 (bits 9, 5, and 0 are set)
PRBS11 : x^11 + x^9 + 1 : 32'h00000A01 (bits 11, 9, and 0 are set)
PRBS15 : x^15 + x^14 + 1 : 32'h0000C001 (bits 15, 14, and 0 are set)
PRBS29 : x^29 + x^27 + 1 : 32'h28000001 (bits 29, 27, and 0 are set)
PRBS polynomials other than those listed above are not guaranteed to be functional as some logic optimizations may have been done to improve the area and performance of the design.
When doing PRBS, bit[0] is ignored and assumed to be 1'b1..
fields.name: LkSerDesTestPatternA
